info.title: DCDS API
info.description: The DCDS API is used by experience builder team of the TaaS platform to perform operations on to send media files downstream. The media file is a data element of TaaS that is associated to the unique request of a platform consumer.

post.summary: Posts a new download request for a given catalog.

requestBody.description: Metadata related to the catalog to download. This includes the mode of communication used to add and the location of the vehicles that the catalog should be downloaded to, the list of media metadata for all the files that needs to be downloaded and the rule file metadata to be downloaded.

EBDownloadRequest.description: EBDownloadRequest represents the wrapper, or meta-data, around the actual catalog description.

mode.description: Can be either OTA or TMS. OTA will be only used for urgent updates of the rule engines or deleting files from the car. This can be an ENUM.

StartTime.description: This is the time from which this catalog is active. Note that this field is defined by the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z. This same time will be mentioned inside the rule file as well for DXP processing.

EndTime.description: The time from which this catalog should be inactive. Note that this field is defined by the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z. This same time will be mentioned inside the rule file as well for DXP processing

payload.description: The payload can be a collection of media metadata

rule.description: The metadata of the rule file for this catalog

items.description: Media defines the information description of a set of media files that will be send to a Vehicle wrapped in a Manifest or Media Meta data. By definition all properties not marked as 'required' are 'optional'.

mediaId.description: The Unique Identifier for the Media

campaignId.description: The Unique Identifer of the campaign.

function.description: Field used to determine the operation that needs to be performed on this media file in the car. Possible values are ADD and DELETE. This can be an ENUM

uri.description: the Universal Resource Identifier(URI) of the specific Media. i.e. Where to 'get' the Media instance data.

mediaType.description: The 'type' of media that the URI instance contains. This field is typically used to help system in the vehicle distribute the media to the appropriate locations. This can be an ENUM.

size.description: The size provided is in MB corrected to 4 digits after decimal(#.####)

hashKey.description: This is a hashcode generated for the file using SHA 256 algorithm.

Rule.title: Rule
Rule.description: Rule defines the information description of a rule file that will be send to a Vehicle wrapped in a Manifest or catalog Meta data. By definition all properties not marked as 'required' are 'optional'.

hashKey.description: This is a hashcode generated for the file using SHA 256 algorithm.

type.description: Type of the file. It can be either MEDIA or RULE. This can be an ENUM.

status.description:
The status of the mediaId on the vehicle
* 'PENDING' - Transmission is 'pending' the download. This will be most often the case when the vehicle has received a manifest for a TMS download and the vehicle has not returned to the terminal yet.
* 'DOWNLOADED' - Media has been downloaded successfully.

ManifestTransmissionStatus.title: Manifest Transmission Status
ManifestTransmissionStatus.description: Manifest Transmission Status represents the status of manifest data with regard to it's transmission to the vehicle from DCDS.

state.description:
State of the transmission for the manifest identified by the manifestId.
* 'PENDING' - Transmission is 'pending' or queued for transmission. The manifest will be requeued until successfully transmitted.
* 'TRANSMITTED' - Manifest has been transmitted successfully.

VehicleConsolidatedStatuses.title: Vehicle Consolidated Media/Manifest Statuses
VehicleConsolidatedStatuses.description: Return the transmission status of the manifest and the URI download status of media files contained in all vehicles sorted by vehicleIdentification

MediaStatus.description: Array of URI download status for media

ManifestStatus.description: Array of Transmission status for manifests.

BaseBodyResult.description: BaseBodyResult(BBR). This is the Ford Base Result message (From Dev Central Stations Spring ReST API project constructors). This object will wrap each result from a request to a ReST API. The BBR will also provide 2 method calls. 'hasResult()' that returns a boolean value indicating whether the result has a non-null result. 'hasError()' returns a boolean value indicating whether the result contain an error.

result.description: This field contains result of the ReST API call. If no result could be returned, this field is null.

error.description: This field contains any error(s) that resulted from the API request. It is possible to have both the result AND the error field populated.

BaseBodyError.description: This is the Ford Base Error Message (From Dev Central Stations Spring ReST API project constructors). This object will be included in the result returned from all ReST calls. If there is no error in the response then this object will be NULL.

errorCode.description: This field contains the overall error code for the response. This is code application/API specific but could by convention be common amoung related projects.

messages.description: This field contains an unbounded array of strings. Typically this would contain information strings from the application, system, network, etc that provide further information on the error.

dataErrors.description: This field contains a list of BaseBodyDataErrors if any data errors occured. Typically these are used for data validation responses and would contain enough information that the UI (if there is one), could direct the user as to what fields were wrong and why.

attributes.description: This field contains Map of key,value pairs (tuples). The key and value may be any object type. This field can provide a location to note generic or wildcard attributes that would be helpful to the caller in determining errors and what to do with the errors.

BaseBodyDataError.description: This is the Ford Base DATA Error Message (From Dev Central Station Spring API and the body of BaseBodyError).

code.description: This is an application unique error code, assigned by the application or API.

message.description: This is the error message that gives more detail to the error code. This message COULD be used to provide the a message to the user of the application, but is meant to simply give more context and detail to the error code.

name.description: This is short descriptive name of the error.

value.description: This 'value' provides more information about the message. Typically corresponding system error messages, values or debug information.
